p: The SORL1 gene encodes the protein SORLA and is associated with Alzheimerâ€™s disease (AD) [ 1]. Recent burden analyses of ultra-rare variants through exome sequencing have found an excess of loss-of-function variants in AD cases, suggesting haploinsufficiency of SORL1 as a pathogenic mechanism in some patients [ 17, 44]. More recently, SORL1 missense variants in familial AD have also been reported [ 11, 29, 32], but the functional consequences of these variants are unknown.
